org.alljoyn.bus

Class SignalEmitter

  • Object
    • SignalEmitter

  • public class SignalEmitter
extends Object
    A helper proxy used by BusObjects to send signals. A SignalEmitter instance can be used to send any signal from a given AllJoyn interface.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  SignalEmitter.GlobalBroadcast
      Controls behavior of broadcast signals (null desintation).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SignalEmitter(BusObject source)
      Constructs a SignalEmitter used for local broadcasting.

      Construct a SignalEmitter used for broadcasting to a session
      SignalEmitter(BusObject source, SignalEmitter.GlobalBroadcast globalBroadcast)
      Constructs a SignalEmitter used for broadcasting.
      SignalEmitter(BusObject source, String destination, int sessionId, SignalEmitter.GlobalBroadcast globalBroadcast)
      Constructs a SignalEmitter.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SignalEmitter

        public SignalEmitter(BusObject source,
             String destination,
             int sessionId,
             SignalEmitter.GlobalBroadcast globalBroadcast)
        Constructs a SignalEmitter.
        Parameters:
        source - the source object of any signals sent from this emitter
        destination - well-known or unique name of destination for signal
        sessionId - A unique SessionId for this AllJoyn session instance
        globalBroadcast - whether to forward broadcast signals across bus-to-bus connections

      • SignalEmitter

        Parameters:

        sessionId - A unique SessionId for this AllJoyn session instance
        globalBroadcast - whether to forward broadcast signals across bus-to-bus connections

    • Method Detail

      • setTimeToLive

        public void setTimeToLive(int timeToLive)
        Sets the time-to-live of future signals sent from this emitter.
        Parameters:
        timeToLive - if non-zero this specifies the useful lifetime for signals sent by this emitter. The units are in milliseconds for non-sessionless signals and seconds for sessionless signals. If delivery of the signal is delayed beyond the timeToLive due to network congestion or other factors the signal may be discarded. There is no guarantee that expired signals will not still be delivered.

      • setCompressHeader

        public void setCompressHeader(boolean compress)
        Enables header compression of future signals sent from this emitter.
        Parameters:
        compress - if true compress header for destinations that can handle header compression

      • setSessionlessFlag

        public void setSessionlessFlag(boolean sessionless)
        Sets the signal to be sent out as a sessionless signal
        Parameters:
        sessionless - if true the signal is set to be sent out as a sessionless signal

      • getMessageContext

        public MessageContext getMessageContext()
        Get the MessageContext of the last signal sent from this emitter.
        Returns:
        MessageContext of the last signal sent from this emitter.

      • cancelSessionlessSignal

        public Status cancelSessionlessSignal(int serialNum)
        Cancel a sessionless signal sent from this SignalEmitter
        Parameters:
        serialNum - Serial number of message to cancel
        Returns:
        • OK if request completed successfully.
        • BUS_NO_SUCH_MESSAGE if message with given serial number could not be located.
        • BUS_NOT_ALLOWED if message with serial number was sent by a different sender.

      • getInterface

        public <T> T getInterface(Class<T> intf)
        Gets a proxy to the interface that emits signals.
        Parameters:
        intf - the interface of the bus object that emits the signals
        Returns:
        the proxy implementing the signal emitter
